navigators.smart.tom
Interface TOMRequestReceiver

All Known Implementing Classes:
BFTMapImpl, CounterServer, LatencyServer, LatencyTestServer, RandomServer, ServiceReplica, ThroughputLatencyServer, ThroughputTestServer, TOMReceiver
public interface TOMRequestReceiver

Interface meant for objects that receive requests from clients

Method Summary
 byte[] getState()
          This method is used by the TOM Layer to retrieve the state of the application.
 void receiveMessage(TOMMessage msg, MessageContext msgCtx)
          This is the method invoked by the TOMLayer to deliver a read only request that was not totally ordered
 void receiveOrderedMessage(TOMMessage msg, MessageContext msgCtx)
          This is the method invoked by the DeliveryThread to deliver a totally ordered request, and where the code to handle the request is to be written
 void setState(byte[] state)
          This method is invoked by the TOM Layer in order to ser a state upon the aplication.
 void waitForProcessingRequests()
          This method waits for the batch of messages to finish being processed
 

Method Detail

receiveOrderedMessage

void receiveOrderedMessage(TOMMessage msg,
                           MessageContext msgCtx)
This is the method invoked by the DeliveryThread to deliver a totally ordered request, and where the code to handle the request is to be written

Parameters:
msg - the delivered request
msgCtx - the context of the message being delivered

receiveMessage

void receiveMessage(TOMMessage msg,
                    MessageContext msgCtx)
This is the method invoked by the TOMLayer to deliver a read only request that was not totally ordered

Parameters:
msg - The request delivered by the TOM layer

getState

byte[] getState()
This method is used by the TOM Layer to retrieve the state of the application. This must be implemented by the programmer, and it should retrieve an array of bytes that contains the application state.

Returns:
An rray of bytes that can be diserialized into the application state

setState

void setState(byte[] state)
This method is invoked by the TOM Layer in order to ser a state upon the aplication. This is done when a replica is delayed compared to the rest of the group, and when it recovers after a failure.

waitForProcessingRequests

void waitForProcessingRequests()
This method waits for the batch of messages to finish being processed
